opendial.bn.distribs.other

Class ConditionalDistribution<T extends IndependentProbDistribution>

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.bn.distribs.other.ConditionalDistribution<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProbDistribution
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConditionalCategoricalTable

    public class ConditionalDistribution<T extends IndependentProbDistribution>
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProbDistribution
    Conditional probability distribution represented as a probability table. The table expresses a generic distribution of type P(X1...Xn|Y1...Yn), where X1...Xn is called the "head" part of the distribution, and Y1...Yn the conditional part.

    This class represent a generic conditional distribution in which the distribution for the head variables X1,...,Xn can be represented using arbitrary distributions of type T.

    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-03-20 21:16:08 #$
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

        public Assignment sample(Assignment condition)
                  throws DialException

      • getProb

        public double getProb(Assignment condition,
                      Assignment head)
               throws DialException
        Returns the probability of the head assignment given the conditional assignment. The method assumes that the posterior distribution has a discrete form.
        Parameters:
        condition - the conditional assignment
        head - the head assignment
        Returns:
        the resulting probability
        Throws:
        DialException - if the probability could not be extracted

      • getValues

        public java.util.Set<Assignment> getValues(ValueRange range)
        Returns all possible values specified in the table. The input values are here ignored (for efficiency reasons), so the method simply extracts all possible head rows in the table.
        Specified by:

      • isWellFormed

        public boolean isWellFormed()
        Returns true if the probability table is well-formed. The method checks that all possible assignments for the condition and head parts are covered in the table, and that the probabilities add up to 1.0f.
        Specified by:
        isWellFormed in interface ProbDistribution
        Returns:
        true if the table is well-formed, false otherwise
